member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects
member.summary: The data structure that is used to pass information between Tingen and Avatar.
The data structure that is used to pass information between Tingen and Avatar.
The data structure that is used to pass information between Avatar and the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para: Additional information about the OptionObjects class TBA.

member.summary: The original data structure sent from Avatar.

member.summary: The data structure that (is potentially) modified during a Tingen Session.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ReturnOptObj
member.summary: The data structure that is returned to Avatar.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ExeAsm
member.summary: The executing Assembly name.
member.remarks: A required component for writing log files, defined here so it can be used throughout the class.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ConvertErrorString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a human-readable error string to the corresponding OptionObject error value.

remarks.para:
When an OptionObject is returned to Avatar, it requires an "error code", which is an integer value.
In order to make this a little easier when developing the Tingen Web Service, there is the option of
using one of the following "error string" instead of the integer value (which will be converted to the
appropriate integer value):
Error string (Error code) Error description
clone/none/success (0) No action taken
error (1) Returns an Error Message and stops further processing of scripts

The systemcode.tngn file should contain a single line of text with one of the following values:
LIVE
UAT

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Runtime.TngnConfiguration.New(System.String)
member.summary: Load the runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.
member.returns: Runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
This method creates a Tingen Web Service configuration object at runtime.
Some of these properties are validated against hardcoded values.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Runtime.SpinUp
member.summary: Startup/shutdown logic for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para: This method contains two methods that startup/shutdown the Tingen Web Service:

This class doesn't do much actual work, and should remain fairly static. For the
most part, it just hands information to Outpost31, where the heavy lifting is done.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Utility.Du.DuFile
member.summary: Logic related to files input/output.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Utility.Du.DuFile.ReadLocal(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the contents or status of a file.

remarks.para:
If the file exists and has content, that content is returned.
If the file does not exist, or exists but is empty, an error message is returned.

member.returns: The content or status of the file.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Utility.Du.DuFile.ReadAndVerifyLocal(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the contents (if valid) or status of a file.

remarks.para:
GetContent() returns the contents or status of the file.
If the file contains data, that data is checked against the list of valid content.

member.returns: The verified content or status of the file.

member.name: T:Outpost31.WelcomeToOutpost31
member.summary: A place for Outpost31 details and stuff.

remarks.para:
Outpost31 is the back-end logic for the Tingen web service.
This class is just a placeholder for documentation, and where the Outpost31 version number is
updated (see the header above).
While you're here, take a look at this stuff:
The Tingen Documentation
Uh...I guess that's it. Thanks for stopping by!
